oai_dc:dc.dc:title: African American child laborers
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two African American male child laborers standing behind a wood chair, each resting one hand on the chair's back. Both boys wear high collars and suit jackets.

Tennessee, which in 1890 had nearly seventy thousand working children between the ages of 10-15, was one of the first states in the country to pass legislation putting restrictions on the use of child labor.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Labor; Labor supply; Child labor--United States; Child labor--Tennessee
